posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.23 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here .

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No major changes this week! Just some bug fixes and other non-visible changes.

Complete list of new commits since 7.22.2
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.22.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.22 release

posts.cooked:
github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Use v2/calling/relays endpoint.

committed 07:58PM - 29 Oct 24 UTC
adel-signal
+25 -23

So I noticed the v2 relays calls commit which is (possibly) related to the new Cloudflare Turn experiment. I have a question about that upcoming feature: will clients be mindful to prioritize turn.cloudflare.com over turn*.voip.signal.org when fronting is enabled?

I mean, if fronting is enabled then it’s pretty much a given that turn*.voip.signal.org is blocked, so would clients do that? Or clients don’t really have to do anything since WebRTC will just figure that out and switch to Cloudflare turn?

Also, some countries that don’t necessarily block Signal itself, will just drop VoIP traffic if they could detect it, unless of course you’re using FB Messenger or the big guys in general. One would think that turn.cloudflare will be on the “allow” list in those countries, as other services would use it. So will WebRTC detect interference to turn*.voip.signal.org and switch to Cloudflare?

Hey @jim-signal can you shed some light on this?

New Version: 7.23.0 (148000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

22 new commits since 7.22.2:

Show commits

  • Synchronize backup checks job. [1]

  • Improve backup export perf by using better batching. [2]

  • Add initial link+sync support. [3]

  • Rewrite App Settings in compose. [4]

  • Remove extra backslash in internal preference summaries. [5]

    Resolves #13746

  • Fix share activity icon tint. [6]

  • Fix possible crash when colorizing group names [7]

    Fixes #13751

  • Migrate linked device status to the SignalStore. [8]

  • Remove unused webrtc proguard file. [9]

  • Update ignore list in apkdiff.py [10]

  • Improving timestamp logging around retry receipts. [11]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.48.4 [12]

  • Use v2/calling/relays endpoint. [13]

  • Remove unused app settings navigation xml. [14]

  • Add "Backups Subscription not found" states. [15]

  • Update various UI for chat folders. [16]

  • Add item animator to chat folders. [17]

  • Add "Ready to download" state and clear out a few TODOs. [18]

  • Fix incorrect backup passphrase error toast not showing. [19]

  • Add MediaNoLongerAvailable wiring. [20]

  • Update translations and other static files. [21]

  • Bump version to 7.23.0 [22]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.22.2…v7.23.0

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Lag has been introduced when entering the menus within the settings screen and backing out to the main settings screen.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.23.0/42f27387a214557eafdf4942731f3c7255ef5853f809f693ce0aa6964e824b03

posts.name: Orange Elephant
posts.cooked:
The notifications bar on the new settings screen doesnt change colour on scroll now.

The text colour for the about section of profile is also wrong, and this also now wraps to the next line instead of cutting off like it used to, which looks weird for the longest description 140 characters.

Screenshot

10000061811024×425 24.5 KB

Tangientially related UI issues:

The code/ scan tabs selection on the QR page aren’t centred above the QR code itself which is very annoying

Screenshot

10000061841024×399 11.6 KB

The about contact bottom sheet doesn’t show the emoji associated with their “about” summary whereas in settings the pencil/edit icon is replaced with the emoji if present.

Screenshot

10000061851024×535 32.8 KB

I also just noticed that the banners split the top bar and chat folders selection which looks bizarre.

Also the ‘X’ to close the banner is the wrong colour in dark mode

Screenshot

10000061901024×743 52.9 KB

updates-bot:

Migrate linked device status to the SignalStore. [8]

Thanks for following up and unifying the states, Greyson!

There’s one more inconsistency that leads Signal to think it’s in multi device mode when it’s not, though:

Users of AppDependencies.signalServiceAccountManager.devices filter out the default device (SignalServiceAddress.DEFAULT_DEVICE_ID) so they can accurately determine if there are linked devices or not. Except LinkedDeviceInactiveCheckJob which doesn’t filter it out, which leads it to thinks there’s a linked device even though there isn’t:

github.com

signalapp/Signal-Android/blob/d002427b2504871008234d29e711cfbd25b92052/app/src/main/java/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/jobs/LinkedDeviceInactiveCheckJob.kt#L71


      
    
          
  1. 
          
  2. override fun getFactoryKey(): String = KEY
    3. 
          
  3. 
          
  4. override fun run(): Result {
    5. 
          
  5.   if (!SignalStore.account.isRegistered) {
    6. 
          
  6.     Log.i(TAG, "Not registered, skipping.")
    7. 
          
  7.     return Result.success()
    8. 
          
  8.   }
    9. 
          
  9. 
          
  10.   val devices = try {
    11. 
          
  11.     AppDependencies.signalServiceAccountManager.devices
    12. 
          
  12.   } catch (e: IOException) {
    13. 
          
  13.     return Result.retry(defaultBackoff())
    14. 
          
  14.   }
    15. 
          
  15. 
          
  16.   if (devices.isEmpty()) {
    17. 
          
  17.     Log.i(TAG, "No linked devices found.")
    18. 
          
  18. 
          
  19.     SignalStore.account.hasLinkedDevices = false
    20. 
          
  20.     SignalStore.misc.leastActiveLinkedDevice = null
    21. 
          
  21.     SignalStore.misc.linkedDeviceLastActiveCheckTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
    22.

posts.cooked:
Sorry, a bit late as it belongs to the last beta, but when long clicking a chat folder and hitting “edit folder”, the back key brings me to the settings instead of the chat list where I was before.

Wow, indeed fixed meanwhile

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: Can’t reproduce this bug on 7.23.1

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
clicked on the reply button to a story the exact moment it was deleted by the uploader - this resulted in a crash (or at the very least, something that looked like a crash, the debug didn’t pop up automatically and I had to get it manually)

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.23.0/4e6bb33f3496d5d1045de6af7a293ddad3a5df00a587c65f33a3e920a8c5b924

Swiping to switch folders would make them easier to use. Right now I have to reach with my thumb from the bottom-middle all the way to the top of the screen. Maybe have it so you can still swipe a conversation to archive, but if you swipe in empty space, it’ll change the folder.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: It would also be cool that if you have the Unread chats folder, once your read all of them, it switches back to the main “all chats” folder

hmzuleta:

cool that if you have the Unread chats folder, once your read all of them, it switches back to the main “all chats” folder

I thought you were going to write that the Unread folder disappears. And then reappears when there are new unread messages. That might be cool too?

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

Swiping to switch folders would make them easier to use.

I agree, although there is a bunch of stuff competing for that swipe. One could probably make a better argument for swiping switching the bottom tab bar (calls + stories), since that’s would match the way most android apps behave better. But as it is, I know a lot of people that use swipe-to-archive, so it’s tricky to mess with that (not me, I basically never archive anything lol).

link_counts.title: Swipe to archive without affecting read status

posts.cooked: The bottom bar was the other option, but swiping empty space sounded less friction-y/complicated to implement (to a non-dev).

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Aku-Stable:

I thought you were going to write that the Unread folder disappears.

Yeah this also makes a lot of sense

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

The bottom bar was the other option, but swiping empty space sounded less friction-y/complicated to implement (to a non-dev).

Oh I meant that if we were to take swiping away from archiving and assigning it some other purpose, it’d make more sense to have it swipe horizontally between (chats, calls, stories), since that’s the primary nav bar presented to every user, whereas folders are like a nested nav bar that just exists in chats for some users.

That said, I don’t see us changing the swipe behavior at this moment. I know we could do something with swiping empty space, but I think the lack of consistency there might be confusing, and it doesn’t help people whose chat folders fill the screen.

greyson-signal:

Oh I meant that if we were to take swiping away from archiving and assigning it some other purpose, it’d make more sense to have it swipe horizontally between (chats, calls, stories), since that’s the primary nav bar presented to every user

Oh fair point. That does complicate things a bit, but that makes sense since it’s how it works in WhatsApp. I appreciate your engagement with my Development Muggle musings .

I’m having an issue where I can’t delete chats and archiving takes forever, even for tiny chats. I also can’t seem to submit a request through “Contact US” in the app. It just greys out the text box and the circle that appears after I hit “Next” runs until the “Next” button eventually just reappears with my text still in the text box.

posts.name: xav1er
posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

Oh I meant that if we were to take swiping away from archiving and assigning it some other purpose, it’d make more sense to have it swipe horizontally between (chats, calls, stories), since that’s the primary nav bar presented to every user, whereas folders are like a nested nav bar that just exists in chats for some users.

That said, I don’t see us changing the swipe behavior at this moment. I know we could do something with swiping empty space, but I think the lack of consistency there might be confusing, and it doesn’t help people whose chat folders fill the screen.

No, it doesn’t make sense to assign the swipe feature to the bottom bar, as it’s already easy to reach. The main reason everyone wants a swipe feature is to easily switch between chat folders, as it’s hard to access them at the top especially for users with large phones, where reaching the top is inconvenient. So, it makes more sense to have the swipe feature switch between chat folders instead of the bottom bar, since the bottom bar is already easy to use.

With chat folders at the top, it’s difficult for users with larger phones to reach them one-handed. A swipe gesture makes this effortless.

The bottom bar is already easy to tap, so a swipe gesture is redundant there. Keeping it a tap-only interaction avoids confusing gestures on the primary nav.

Most messaging apps use swiping to switch between folders, so users would naturally expect Signal to do the same, minimizing the learning curve.

For those who use multiple chat folders regularly, a swipe shortcut would make switching between folders faster and more fluid.
